About BHPWe are a leading natural resources company dedicated to connecting resources and people to create a better world. Our focus is on responsibly developing essential resources for global decarbonization, such as iron ore, metallurgical coal, and copper, which are vital for modern infrastructure.Our USA corporate office is located in Tucson, Arizona, where our Metals Exploration and Legacy Assets teams work towards this mission. Our global strategy emphasizes managing a resilient portfolio of valuable assets in attractive commodities.We excel in operations and asset acquisition, fostering innovative technologies to enhance safety, productivity, and sustainability while upholding our social commitments.What We OfferBecause we care about our people, we offer a strong value preposition that includes:Market competitive salary plus an annual incentive program Development and growth opportunities together with education assistance and support Exceptional benefits program, including Dental and Vision care Attractive share matching plan Employee Assistance program for you and your family And more‚Ä¶ About The RoleThe Specialist Geoscientist role, will be core member of the Peru Discovery team responsible for identifying, executing and advancing exploration of porphyry-skarn copper projects and accountable for carrying out high quality data capture, analysis, and interpretation leading to business decision makingAssists in project evaluation, provision of technical guidance, and supports the maintenance of a quality and healthy portfolio, contribuiting to support high standards of work and technical rigour through collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the overall plan and deliverables are being metMain ResponsibilitiesSupport the selection of target areas and appropriate methodologies for sampling and data collection to build ore body knowledge that enables value decisions for BHP. Develops, implements and monitors sampling-analysis protocols & QA/QC programs to quantify the quality, risks and compliance of geological data. Performs geological modelling based on integrated datasets to analyse and interpret target areas and generate valuable orebody knowledge. Applies a scientific methodology to investigate various hypotheses or questions and draw inferences on possible solutions. About YouPivotal Experiences for the role:Strong commitment to safety, social value and sustainability.Sound understanding of porphyry-skarn copper deposits, geological features and mineral system frameworks.Technical understanding and a strategic view of how to accomplish results through influencing to accomplish successful performance of the role.Also RequiredDegree in Geology or related science from a reputable university.5+ years of experience in geosciences and understanding of exploration workflow as applied to copper exploration.Intermediate user in common industry software for geoscientific data (ArcGIS Pro, Leapfrog, etc).Spanish and English fluency.About Our ProcessAt BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are several checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants' suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.‚ÄØWe are committed to a selection process that is fair, equitable and accessible to all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be necessary to adjust our selection process to suit your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.comIf you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal.Supporting a Diverse Workforce At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that‚Äôs more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect.Join us to make a difference.Why not you? Why not BHP?

4.2-star rating on GlassDoor.Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.The OpportunityJoin our talent network and connect with U.S. clients for flexible, project-based development work as a Senior Software Engineer in Test.You will integrate directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis.What We're Looking systems.Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon.Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.What We OfferCompetitive pay.100% remote work.The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.Continuing education opportunities.Opportunity to grow and expand your career.Our talent network is committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and accessible environment where IT professionals can find opportunities that match their skills. We welcome individuals of all races, religions, genders, sexual orientations, national origins, abilities, and experiences. Our focus is on connecting talent with projects based on qualifications, ensuring a fair and transparent process that values diverse perspectives and global collaboration.Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice.
